readability_reflection: I found the string concatenation more readable. Everything was much more spaced out and easier on the eyes than the interpolation. For example, the the website problems, I found an easier time finding each part for the concatenation.
comprehension_debugging: For the more complex examples where just the concatenation and interpolation was shown, I struggled to make sense of both code snippets. I believe it's because the definitions were not given, so my brain had a hard time wrapping my head around how the output should look within a time limit. For example, "( 0 " + "1 )" with strings and concatenation combined were a little struggling.
preference_rationale: I would choose string concatenation. For me, it was more readable and I had an easier time understanding the code snippets.
learning_curve: I did impact my ease for the provided code examples. Although, I believe since both concepts are easy to understand, someone who has no knowledge of coding could also understand concatenation and interpolation easily. Since I am familiar with both to a minimal extent, as the questions got harder, I struggled upon what the output should look like.
suggestions_improvement: Personally, on the surface level I believe both interpolation and concatenation have simple and understandable syntax. So, N/A.
